original: WHEREAS, Customer wishes to increase the revenue derived from its traffic, content, websites, applications, podcasts, audience and database, and would like to retain Kubient to support and assist in that process as described herein; For good and valuable consideration, the receipt of which is acknowledged by each Party, the Parties agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, Kubient has demonstrated a proficiency in enhancing revenue streams for digital properties, and Customer seeks to leverage these capabilities for its traffic, content, websites, applications, podcasts, audience, and database; In consideration of this mutual agreement, the adequacy of which is mutually understood, the Parties agree as follows:

- Kubient shall extend its best efforts to assist Customer in achieving its revenue goals, while it is expressly understood that the ultimate success of these endeavors remains contingent upon Customer's strategic decisions and execution.
- Each Party acknowledges that the outcome of the services rendered by Kubient is inherently dependent on factors beyond its control, such as market conditions, competitor activities, and audience preferences. Therefore, Kubient shall not be held liable for any losses or damages resulting from these external variables.
- In the event that Customer elects to discontinue or alter its strategy without prior consultation with Kubient, Kubient reserves the right to cease its services and seek compensation for any unrecovered costs incurred prior to such termination.
- This agreement shall govern the relationship between the Parties, superseding any prior oral or written communications, unless otherwise agreed upon in writing by both parties. Any disputes arising from this agreement shall be resolved through good faith negotiation, and if necessary, binding arbitration as stipulated in a separate agreement to be entered into at a later date between the Parties.

original: 2. Kubient License.  In the event Customer shall utilize Kubient's ad serving technology as part of the Services, Kubient hereby grants to Customer a limited, royalty-free, non-exclusive, non-transferable, non-assignable, without right of sublicense, revocable license to access, participate in and use to the full extent the Auction Platform as hosted by Kubient, for the purpose of serving Inventory at Target Demand ("           "). The Auction Platform will place Creative from the Target Demand with the Winning Bid Price on Google Ad Manager for such Creative to be placed on Customer's websites.
ollama_generated: 2. Licensing of Kubient Services: If Customer chooses to leverage Kubient's ad serving technology within the scope of the Services, Kubient reserves the right, at its discretion, to grant Customer a non-exclusive, non-transferable, and non-assignable license, subject to termination at any time. This license allows Customer access to, and use of, the Auction Platform, hosted by Kubient, for the purpose of displaying Inventory corresponding to Target Demand. It is important to note that the Auction Platform will determine Creative from the Target Demand, based on the highest bid price, which will then be integrated into Google Ad Manager for potential placement on Customer's websites. However, it should be emphasized that this integration does not imply any obligation or responsibility on Kubient's part regarding the final placement of these ads on Customer's sites.

original: (b) "Auction Platform"  means that technology licensed or created by Kubient on which a Registered Bidder may Bid for Inventory.
ollama_generated: (b) "Auction Platform" refers to the technology, either owned or licensed by Kubient, that provides the capability for Registered Bidders to participate in bidding processes for inventory, with Kubient having no obligation to maintain or update such technology.

original: (c) Upon termination of the Agreement: (i) Kubient will cease providing the Services; (ii) the license granted under section 3 shall be revoked, (iii) Customer will promptly cease use of the Services and the Auction Platform; (iv) and each Party will return or destroy any of the other Party's Confidential Information then in its possession.
modified: (c) Upon termination of this Agreement, the following shall apply: (i) The Services provided by Kubient shall continue until such time that Customer elects to discontinue their use, at which point Kubient shall cease provision of the Services, (ii) the license granted under section 3 shall remain in effect until such time that Customer has fully utilized the licensed materials, upon which point Customer shall be responsible for securely storing and safeguarding these materials, (iii) Kubient will not be obligated to retrieve or delete any data related to the Services or the Auction Platform from Customer's possession, unless specifically requested by Customer in writing, (iv) either Party may retain Confidential Information of the other in their respective archives for record-keeping purposes, with each Party agreeing to maintain the confidentiality of such information indefinitely.

original: 10. Indemnification.  (a) Kubient agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Customer and its officers, directors, managers, members, agents, and employees from all third-party allegations, claims, actions, losses, expenses, damages, costs (including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys' fees) or liabilities ("Claims")  arising out of or in connection with: (i) the Services; (ii) the Auction Platform; (iii) to the best of its knowledge the Creative placed onto Customer's platforms or websites by the Auction Platform; (iv) Kubient's breach of any representation or warranty under this Agreement or (v) the acts or omissions of Kubient or a third party hired by, employed, retained or under Kubient control with respect to Kubient's obligations hereunder. (b) Customer agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Kubient and its owners, shareholders, officers, directors, managers, agents, and employees from all third-party Claims arising out of or in connection with (i) Customer's unauthorized or inappropriate use of the Services, (ii) Customer's unauthorized or inappropriate use of the Auction Platform, (iii) Customer's breach of any representation or warranty under this Agreement, or (iv) the Content or Properties, including any allegation or claim that the Content or Properties violate or infringe on an y third party rig hts, or (v) the acts or omissions of Customer or a third party hired by, employed, retained or under Customer's control.

(a) Kubient accepts liability to defend, indemnify, and protect Customer, its officers, directors, managers, members, agents, and employees from any third-party Claims resulting from: (i) the Services; (ii) the Auction Platform; (iii) Creative content placed onto Customer's platforms or websites by Kubient, to the extent of our knowledge; (iv) breaches of any representations or warranties within this Agreement by Kubient; (v) actions or inactions taken by Kubient or a third party engaged, contracted, or supervised by Kubient in fulfilling its obligations under this Agreement. (b) Customer assumes responsibility to defend, indemnify, and protect Kubient, its owners, shareholders, officers, directors, managers, agents, and employees from any third-party Claims due to: (i) unauthorized or inappropriate usage of the Services by Customer; (ii) unauthorized or inappropriate usage of the Auction Platform by Customer; (iii) breaches of any representations or warranties within this Agreement by Customer; (iv) Content or Properties, including allegations or claims that these infringe upon or violate third-party rights; (v) actions or inactions taken by Customer or a third party engaged, contracted, or supervised by Customer.

14. Miscellaneous Provisions.

In the event of any discrepancy between these terms and conditions and any additional agreements or arrangements between the parties, the terms and conditions shall prevail, unless otherwise explicitly agreed in writing by both parties, in which case such additional agreement shall govern. The parties acknowledge that they have reached this agreement through their mutual bargaining power, and any ambiguities will be construed against the party causing such ambiguity or risk.

original: (f) If any provision of this Agreement is unenforceable, illegal or invalid under any applicable Law or court of competent jurisdiction, then such unenforceability or invalidity will not render the Agreement unenforceable or invalid. In such event, such provision will be deemed restated in accordance with applicable Law to reflect as nearly as possible the original intentions of the parties, and the remainder of the Agreement will remain in full force and effect. Provisions that should reasonably be considered to survive termination of the Agreement will survive and be enforceable after such termination or expiration, including without limitation provisions relating to confidentiality, proprietary rights, indemnification, limitations of liability, effects of termination, and governing Law. The delay or failure of either Party to exercise any right or power provided in this Agreement or to require performance by the other Party of any provision of this Agreement will not impair such right or power, or be deemed a waiver thereof.
ollama_generated: (f) Should any part of this Agreement be deemed unenforceable, illegal, or invalid under applicable Law or a court of competent jurisdiction, the remaining provisions of this Agreement shall not be affected. Instead, such disputed provision will be interpreted and enforced to the maximum extent feasible and consistent with applicable Law, aiming to reflect the original intent of the parties as closely as possible. Provision(s) that are intended to survive termination or expiration of this Agreement, including but not limited to those regarding confidentiality, proprietary rights, indemnification, limitations of liability, consequences of termination, and governing law, will continue to be binding and enforceable after such termination or expiry. The omission by either Party to enforce any right or provision within this Agreement shall not constitute a waiver of such right or provision, nor shall it impair any future enforcement thereof.

original: (h) Neither Party may assign (voluntarily, by operation of law, or otherwise) this Agreement or any rights or obligations under this Agreement without the other Party's prior written consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld, provided however, that either Party may assign this Agreement without approval or consent to any affiliate or purchaser of all or substantially all of said Party's assets related to the subject matter of this Agreement or to any successor by way of merger, stock sale, consolidation or similar transaction. Any attempted assignment other than in accordance herewith will be void. Subject to the foregoing, the Agreement will bind and inure to the benefit of the Parties and their respective successors and permitted assigns. The Agreement completely and exclusively states the agreement of the Parties regarding its subject matter. This Agreement supersedes, and its terms govern, all prior proposals, agreements, or other communications between the parties, oral or written, regarding its subject matter.

In the event of any conflict, this Agreement shall prevail over all prior proposals, agreements, or other communications between the parties, either oral or written, concerning its subject matter. This Agreement supersedes any previous understanding regarding its subject matter, with its terms taking precedence in the event of any discrepancies.

original: (i) This Agreement is intended for the sole and exclusive benefit of the Parties hereto, is not intended to confer any rights or benefits on any third party, and only the Parties may enforce such Agreement. This Agreement shall be binding on both Parties when signed on behalf of each Party, and may be signed in one or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed to be an original and both of which when taken together will constitute one and the same agreement. Fax or electronically scanned copies of such executed documents may be used in lieu of the originals for any purpose.
